The accused entered the hospital in an inebriated condition and fought with a senior citizen who was getting treated for a dog bite, the official said, adding that he assaulted the doctor when he intervened.

175.title: Prime accused in Mohali RPG attack arrested in Mumbai
175.article_body: The prime accused in the rocket-propelled grenade (RPG) attack on Punjab Police's intelligence headquarters in Mohali was arrested in Mumbai on Thursday. Charat Singh had allegedly provided ammunition to those who hurled RPG at the headquarters in May 2022. Charat, an aide of Canada-based gangster Lakhbir Singh, was on parole in a murder case when he committed the crime.

176.title: Stalker kills 20-year-old woman by pushing her in front of moving train in Chennai
176.article_body: A 20-year-old college student was killed after being deliberately pushed by her stalker in front of a moving train at St Thomas Mount Railway Station in Chennai. As per preliminary reports, the duo had a heated argument on the platform before the man committed the crime. The police have formed two special teams to nab the accused, who is absconding.

177.title: Prototype turbine sets world record of generating most power in 24 hrs
177.article_body: Siemens Gamesa's prototype wind turbine generated 359 megawatt-hours of power in one day, setting the world record for the most amount of power generated in a 24-hour period. Power generated by the prototype would be enough to power 18,000 households. The breakthrough was achieved using a set of "revolutionary" blades that are cast in a single piece of recyclable resin.

178.title: 4-week-old lost leopard cub reunited with mother at Mumbai park
178.article_body: A lost leopard cub was reunited with its mother at Mumbai's Sanjay Gandhi National Park (SGNP) by officials of the forest department on Wednesday. A video showed the mother nursing the four-week-old cub before the two disappeared in the bushes. The cub was found by security staff on Monday at Film City, 100 metres from the boundary wall of SGNP.

179.title: I will go on to do bigger things: Sourav Ganguly on exit from BCCI
179.article_body: Sourav Ganguly, who'll reportedly hold no post in BCCI following his end of tenure as BCCI President, said, "I've been an administrator and I'll move on to something else." He added, "I will go on to do bigger things. You can't be a player forever, you can't be an administrator forever. It's been great doing both."

180.title: 6,436 madrasas found unrecognised, survey to continue: UP minister
180.article_body: UP Minority Welfare Minister Dharampal Singh on Wednesday said that 6,436 unrecognised madrasas have been identified in the state so far. He said the survey of UP's unrecognized madrasas will continue as its time period has been extended till October 20. He added that the survey is being conducted in view of better education for the children of minority communities.

181.title: Coal India signs MoU to set up 1,190 MW solar power plant in Rajasthan
181.article_body: Coal India Ltd (CIL) signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Rajasthan Vidyut Utpadan Nigam Ltd (RVUNL) to install a 1,190-MW solar power plant in Bikaner district of Rajasthan. The solar plant will be set up in a 2,000-MW solar park in Poogal, Bikaner. The state government has allotted 4,846 hectare land to develop the park.

182.title: We do not support dual employment: Infosys on moonlighting
182.article_body: Infosys CEO Salil Parekh spoke on the moonlighting debate in the IT industry and said, "To be clear, we don't support dual employment." He said that the company supports employees working on certain external gig projects after the prior approval of managers. He also revealed Infosys let go of some employees after they were found working in two different companies.

183.title: Huge outrage in Patel community: Kejriwal on Gopal Italia's arrest
183.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday criticised the detention of party's Gujarat unit president Gopal Italia over his alleged objectionable remarks against PM Narendra Modi. Tweeting over his detention, Kejriwal said, "With the arrest of Gopal Italia, there's huge anger among the Patel community in Gujarat." "Why the entire BJP after Italia?" he said in another post.

184.title: 58-yr-old watchman rapes 11-yr-old girl waiting for teacher in Mumbai
184.article_body: Mumbai Police on Wednesday arrested a 58-year-old watchman for allegedly raping an 11-year-old girl. According to Mumbai Police, the girl had gone to tuition but decided to wait for her teacher who hadn't reached. Upon seeing the girl alone, the accused took her to a secluded spot and committed the crime. She informed her teacher later, police said.

185.title: Italia is Sardar Patel's descendant, isn’t afraid of jail: AAP MP
185.article_body: After AAP's Gujarat chief Gopal Italia was detained by the Delhi Police from the office of NCW on Thursday, AAP MP Raghav Chadha said, "Gopal Italia is a descendant of Sardar Patel. He isn't afraid of your jail." Italia had been summoned by NCW chief Rekha Sharma over a video allegedly showing him using derogatory language against PM Narendra Modi.

186.title: Singapore Airlines holds talks with Tata over integration of Vistara, Air India
186.article_body: Singapore Airlines (SIA) said that it has held confidential discussions with the Tata Group over a potential integration deal involving Vistara and Air India. "The discussions seek to deepen the existing partnership between SIA and Tata," Singapore Airlines said in a statement. However, it added the discussions were ongoing and no definitive terms were agreed upon yet.

187.title: Infosys' attrition drops to 27.1%, net employee addition at 10,032 in Jul-Sept
187.article_body: Infosys on Thursday reported a 1.3% QoQ drop in its voluntary attrition rate from 28.4% in April-June quarter to 27.1% in July-September quarter. The IT firm added that its net employee addition in the quarter was 10,032 individuals, down 52.6% QoQ from net employee addition of 21,171 people in April-June quarter. Infosys' share of female employees remained stable at 39.3%.

188.title: Cyberabad Police launch 10 more Traffic Task Force teams to regulate traffic
188.article_body: Cyberabad Police launched 10 more 'Traffic Task Force' teams on Wednesday to help regulate traffic movement on busy roads. Cyberabad Police Commissioner, Stephen Raveendra, flagged off the teams comprising two policemen each at IT corridor, Gachibowli. The police teams are provided with motorcycles and they will be able to swiftly act wherever there are traffic jams or slowdowns, Raveendra said.

189.title: Infosys announces share buyback proposal of ₹9,300 crore
189.article_body: Infosys' board of directors approved the buyback proposal aggregating to ₹9,300 crore in order to reward its shareholders. The company will buy back 5 crore shares via the open market route at a price of ₹1,850 per share. The approval was granted alongside the company's Q2 results, where Infosys reported an 11% YoY increase in consolidated net profit.

190.title: 3 accused in Kerala human sacrifice case sent to 12-day police custody
190.article_body: A magistrate court in Kerala's Ernakulam has sent the three accused persons in the alleged human sacrifice case in Kerala to police custody for 12 days. The accused had killed two women, allegedly as part of a human sacrifice for financial gain. One of the accused reportedly confessed that they consumed a portion of the victims' body parts after cooking.

191.title: Meta to let users add legs to their metaverse avatars
191.article_body: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg has announced that users will now be able to add legs to their metaverse avatars. "I know you've been waiting for this...But...legs are hard, which is why other virtual reality systems don't have them either," Zuckerberg's avatar said during a presentation. Meta also announced that it's bringing avatars to video call, starting with WhatsApp and Messenger.

192.title: Vedantu buys majority stake in test prep platform Deeksha for $40 mn
192.article_body: Tiger Global-backed edtech startup Vedantu said it has acquired a majority stake in offline test preparation platform Deeksha for $40 million. Karnataka-based Deeksha was founded by Sridhar G in 1998 and has centres in Karnataka, Telangana, and Andhra Pradesh. The investment in Deeksha will bring about 13,000 students to Bengaluru-based Vedantu's platform, the latter said.

193.title: Zaporizhzhia does not need Russian fuel: Ukraine nuclear company chief
193.article_body: Ukraine's nuclear energy company Energoatom's chief Petro Kotin has denounced Russia's comments that Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant will need Russian fuel, Reuters reported. "There are a lot of rumours...from Russians...it's not easy to just transfer the fuel loading in Zaporizhzhia from one supplier to another," Kotin said. Fresh fuel supplies are in storage at the plant, he added.

194.title: Veranda Learning acquires CA coaching centre JK Shah Classes for ₹337.82 crore
194.article_body: Edtech firm Veranda Learning Solutions on Thursday announced it has signed a definitive agreement for the acquisition of 39-year-old CA coaching centre JK Shah Classes for ₹337.82 crore. The 39-year coaching centre's alumni include billionaire Kumar Mangalam Birla and Union Minister Piyush Goyal, professor JK Shah said. After the acquisition, Shah will remain Chairman for life on the board.

195.title: Army's assault dog Zoom, who fought terrorists despite being shot twice, martyred
195.article_body: Army assault dog Zoom, who was shot twice while fighting terrorists in J&K's Anantnag, succumbed to his injuries on Thursday while undergoing treatment. Zoom passed away at around 12 pm at the Advance Field Veterinary Hospital. The Army had sent Zoom inside the house where the terrorists were holed up during a cordon and search operation.

196.title: Man called me 'B' word, sister Akshara hit him from behind: Shruti Haasan
196.article_body: Actress Shruti Haasan revealed her sister Akshara Haasan has beaten up people for her. Recalling an incident, she said, "Somebody called me the 'B' word once, and next thing I hear is this man screaming...Akshara hitting him from behind and saying, 'How dare you call my sister that?'" "I was more like a verbal assault...she is more violent," Shruti added.

197.title: That's the whole point: Dwayne on possible Black Adam vs Superman film
197.article_body: Hollywood actor Dwayne Johnson has spoken about the possibility of a film where his character Black Adam fights Superman on screen. When asked about a Black Adam and Superman crossover film, Dwayne replied, "Absolutely. That is the whole point of this [Black Adam's stand alone film], man." 'Black Adam' is a spin-off of 2019 film 'Shazam!', featuring Zachary Levi.

198.title: Nehru's 'insertion' of Article 370 caused Kashmir issue, PM resolved it: Shah
198.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday said due to former PM Jawaharlal Nehru's "mistake" of "inserting Article 370, Kashmir was in a mess". Furthermore, he added, "It couldn't be properly integrated with the country. Everybody wanted the removal of Article 370. Prime Minister Narendra Modi removed it in one stroke and completed the integration of Kashmir with the country."

199.title: IIT graduate's AI investment advisory firm raises $1 mn in funding
199.article_body: Artificial intelligence (AI) investment advisory firm Wright Research has raised $1 million in seed funding from Orios Venture Partners. Founded in 2019 by IIT Kanpur graduate Sonam Srivastava, the wealth-tech startup previously raised a pre-seed round with BSE Institute Startup Incubator through Nidhi Seed Support System. Wright Research claims it has almost ₹200 crore in assets under advisory.

200.title: Mumbai to get over 5,800 new CCTVs by the end of December
200.article_body: Mumbai is expected to get 5,837 new CCTV cameras by the end of December as part of the second phase of the surveillance network, home department officials said. The new CCTVs will come up at more than 2,300 locations at the cost of ₹323 crore. Apart from helping curb crime, the cameras are used for traffic management and disaster management.

201.title: Sajid asked me to raise my top and show stomach for giving me role: Actress Kanishka Soni
201.article_body: Actress Kanishka Soni claimed that filmmaker Sajid Khan, who's currently a contestant in 'Bigg Boss 16', called her to his home and asked her to raise her top to show stomach for giving her a role in his movie in 2008. "I feel so insecure while telling you all the whole truth...These powerful personalities can kill me anytime," she added.

202.title: At least cross check: 'Taarak...' director on news reports saying Disha has cancer
202.article_body: Denying reports, which claimed that Disha Vakani is suffering from throat cancer, 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah' director Malav Rajda said people should "at least cross check" such news. Stating that the reports are "completely false", Rajda added that such reports "can affect so many people". Disha is known for playing Dayaben in 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah'.

203.title: Mumbai's Metro Line 2A, 7 clear designs and standards testing
203.article_body: The Mumbai Metro Line 2A (Dahisar to DN Nagar) and Line 7 (Dahisar East to Andheri East) have cleared RDSO (Research Designs and Standards Organisation) testing and will now undergo testing for signalling, an MMRDA official said. "The RDSO test is an important milestone that has been achieved. In the next few days, certification will be issued," the official added.

204.title: 74-year-old man beaten to death with sticks in Varanasi, 5 arrested
204.article_body: A 74-year-old man died after allegedly being beaten with sticks by a group of men near his house in UP's Varanasi on Wednesday night, police said. Five of the 17 accused were arrested while nine police personnel have been suspended. The victim and his son were purportedly attacked when they objected to a group of men fighting near their house.

205.title: 15-year-old girl found hanging from tree in Jharkhand's Dumka
205.article_body: A 15-year-old tribal girl, who studied in Class 10, was found hanging in Jharkhand's Dumka district on Wednesday, said police. The victim's father said that a 22-year-old man, with whom her daughter was having an affair, killed her and hanged her body to make it look like suicide. He said the man told him where he could find his daughter.

206.title: Passenger vehicle wholesales rise by 92% in September
206.article_body: Passenger vehicle wholesales in India surged by 92% to 3,07,389 units in September as compared to 1,60,212 units in the corresponding month last year, the Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers said on Thursday. Two-wheeler sales also increased by 13% to 17,35,199 units as against 15,37,604 vehicles in September 2021. Total commercial vehicle sales rose by 39% to 2,31,880 units.

207.title: Iran's Chief Justice orders harsh sentences for 'main elements of riots': Report
207.article_body: Chief Justice of Iran Gholam Hossein Mohseni Ejei has ordered judges to issue tough sentences for the "main elements of riots" sparked after death of Mahsa Amini, a report said. Judges have been reportedly instructed to "avoid showing unnecessary sympathy". Protests broke out after 22-year-old Amini died after being arrested by Iran's morality police for not following Islamic dress code.

208.title: Unable to recover loan from defaulters, bank manager kills self in Puducherry
208.article_body: A bank manager working at UCO Bank in Puducherry hanged himself after being unable to recover the loans from defaulters. The manager reportedly issued loans to many people in order to reach the targets. On being unable to recover loans and bear pressure from higher authorities, he himself took a loan and later committed suicide due to financial pressure.

209.title: Gold, foreign currency worth ₹8 cr seized at Mumbai airport; 7 held
209.article_body: Mumbai airport's Customs department seized 15 kilograms of gold worth ₹7.87 crore in four different cases and also seized foreign currency worth ₹22 lakh in two different cases. As many as seven people were arrested, reports said. In one of the cases, an Indian national was held with gold over ₹5.20 crore, which was hidden in a chest belt.

210.title: British artist live-streams burning 1,000 of his paintings after selling them as NFTs
210.article_body: British artist Damien Hirst burnt 1,000 paintings that were a part of his collection called 'The Currency' after he sold them in digital form as non-fungible tokens (NFTs). After launching the collection in 2021, Hirst gave a choice to buyers to either keep the NFT or acquire a piece of the physical work. He also live-streamed himself burning the paintings.

211.title: Indian startup funding at 2-year low in Q3: Report
211.article_body: Amid global funding winter, Indian startup funding hit a two-year low at $2.7 billion in the third quarter of the year across 205 deals, according to a report by PwC India. The report stated that the decline was the least at the early stage of funding. The funding activity declined to $2.7 billion from $6.6 billion in the previous quarter.

212.title: Man arrested from T'gana for killing IB officer during 2020 Delhi riots
212.article_body: A 34-year-old man, one of the accused in Intelligence Bureau (IB) officer Ankit Sharma's murder during the 2020 Delhi riots, has been arrested from Telangana's Meerpet, officials said. The accused was arrested from a chemist shop that he used to visit, police added. Sharma was stabbed 52 times by sharp-edged weapons, as per the autopsy report.

213.title: Hijab matter will continue to attract SC's attention: Congress
213.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Thursday said, "Supreme Court's split verdict in the hijab case means that the matter will continue to attract the court's attention." Notably, Justice Hemant Gupta upheld the hijab ban in educational institutions in Karnataka, while Justice Sudhanshu Dhulia said, "Wearing hijab is a matter of choice". The court has referred the matter to the CJI.

214.title: I don't even know him: Babar on viral video of Pak TV host criticising him
214.article_body: On being asked about his criticism in reference to a viral video in which Pakistan TV host Aftab Iqbal is seen criticising him, Pakistan captain Babar Azam said, "I don't know who you're talking about. I don't even know him." In the viral clip, Iqbal says, "Babar is no more a star for me...because of his ego issues with players."

215.title: I'm more confident about my game now: Shafali on her form in Asia Cup
215.article_body: India Women opener Shafali Verma, who scored 42 off 28 balls in their semi-final win against Thailand in the ongoing Asia Cup, has said she's more confident about her game now. "The wicket was good to bat and felt good," she said. Shafali has crossed the 40-run mark three times in her five innings in the tournament.

216.title: We have made 12,000 km of rural roads in 8 years in Himachal: PM
216.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday, while addressing a gathering in Himachal Pradesh’s Chamba, said BJP’s double-engine government is trying to build roads in every village. "We have made 12,000 km of rural roads in eight years in Himachal Pradesh," PM Modi added. "BJP's double-engine government made domestic gas connections available for every home," he stated.

217.title: Gang uses FASTag to cheat people in Delhi with new credit cards; 3 held
217.article_body: Delhi Police has busted a gang which used FASTag to cheat people on pretext of activating credit card services. Police have arrested three men and seized luxury vehicles and SUVs. The accused cheated people of ₹80 lakh in under one month. They were caught while police was investigating a murder case as a gang member lived with the murder accused.

218.title: Purely economic move: Saudi Arabia on OPEC+ decision on oil
218.article_body: Saudi Arabia has rejected criticism of an OPEC+ decision to cut oil production target by two million barrels per day from November, saying the decision has purely economic context. The decision was aimed at curbing market volatility, the statement added. This comes after US President Joe Biden pledged "consequences" for US relations with Saudi Arabia.

219.title: Qatar Airways to hire 10,000 staff ahead of FIFA World Cup
219.article_body: Qatar Airways said that it will add a staff of 10,000 to its workforce in preparation for the FIFA World Cup in the country next month. The company said the hiring will be in line with a broader post-pandemic expansion. A spokesperson said recruitment events were held in the Philippines, India and other countries at the end of September.

220.title: Govt allows exports of 3,97,267 tonnes broken rice backed by Letters of Credit
220.article_body: The government said it will allow overseas broken rice shipments of 3,97,267 tonnes backed by Letters of Credit (LCs) issued before September 8. India had banned exports of broken rice on September 8 to augment supplies and calm local prices, trapping nearly 1 million tonnes of rice that was moved to the ports or was in transit.

221.title: Security enhanced in Karnataka's Udupi after SC's hijab verdict
221.article_body: Security has been ramped up in Karnataka's Udupi district after the Supreme Court's split verdict in the hijab case on Thursday. Police said that measures such as continuous patrolling are being undertaken. "Also, [we are] keeping [a] close watch on social media to make sure no attempts [are] made to harm existing peace in the society," said Udupi SP.

222.title: Nirmala Sitharaman holds bilateral talks with counterparts from four nations
222.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman held bilateral talks with counterparts from Japan, Saudi Arabia, the Netherlands, and South Korea. Sitharaman held discussions on topics including energy crisis, inflation amid the Ukraine crisis, debt sustainability, and climate change. She also discussed key agendas related to Indo-Pacific economic cooperation with Japanese counterpart Shunichi Suzuki.

223.title: Indian man allegedly held captive, tortured by employer in Thailand for $3,000 ransom
223.article_body: A man based in Maharashtra's Thane lodged a police complaint alleging that his younger brother has been held captive in Thailand by his employer company since last one month. He stated the company is torturing him and is demanding $3,000 for his release. He also claimed his brother was taken to an unidentified location once he reached Thailand last month.

224.title: Scientists develop boot that allows people to walk 9% faster
224.article_body: Researchers from US' Stanford University have developed an exoskeleton "boot" that allows its wearer to walk 9% faster with 17% less effort. The footwear's motor works with the wearer's calf muscles to give them an extra push with every step. Researchers said the boot could help people with mobility impairments "move throughout the world as they like".

225.title: IAS officer among 3 arrested after ED raids in Chhattisgarh
225.article_body: Enforcement Directorate on Thursday arrested Chhattisgarh cadre IAS officer Sameer Vishnoi and two others following raids in the state on Tuesday in connection with a money laundering case. The three accused have been arrested under criminal sections of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA). ED also sealed the residence of IAS officer and Raigarh District Collector Ranu Sahu.

226.title: ED files chargesheet against journalist Rana Ayyub in Ketto funds case
226.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has filed a chargesheet against journalist Rana Ayyub in a Ghaziabad court under the anti-money laundering law. It claimed Ayyub raised ₹2.69 crore after launching three fundraiser campaigns on 'Ketto' platform for charity work. However, she used most of the funds for herself and only about ₹29 lakh was used for relief work, the agency alleged.

227.title: Urvashi Rautela reacts to allegations of stalking Rishabh Pant, shares Australia map
227.article_body: Actress Urvashi Rautela took to Instagram to react to allegations of her stalking cricketer Rishabh Pant. Urvashi claimed she's being bullied and called a stalker just because she "never says wrong" about anybody. Urvashi, who was accused of visiting Australia to stalk Pant, shared Australia map and wrote, "This is for Indian media to see how big Australia is."

228.title: This is as good a line-up as India ever had: Shastri on team for T20 WC
228.article_body: Former Team India head coach Ravi Shastri, during a media interaction, expressed confidence in India's batting unit for the upcoming T20 World Cup, stating, "This is as good a batting line-up as India ever had in T20 cricket." Shastri added, "This Indian team, they have played superbly in Australia. Those tracks suit their batting."

229.title: Tej Pratap claims he experienced Sai Baba's miracle, video surfaces
229.article_body: RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav's eldest son Tej Pratap Yadav has claimed that he experienced Sai Baba's miracle. In a video that has surfaced online, the RJD leader claimed that he had asked for Sai Baba's 'bhabhoot' (ashes) while watching the saint's serial on TV. The next day he found the 'bhabhoot' in an envelope in his office, he claimed.

230.title: Rains to continue in Hyderabad today, yellow alert issued: IMD
230.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a yellow alert in seven zones of Hyderabad, warning of moderate rainfall and thunderstorms in the city over the following three days. According to the Telangana State Development Planning Society (TSDPS), Hyderabad will continue to receive rainfall till October 16. Many areas of Hyderabad witnessed waterlogging after heavy rains on Wednesday.

231.title: Law student writes tiny notes on pens to cheat in exam in Spain; pics go viral
231.article_body: Pictures of 11 pens on which a law student wrote notes to cheat in an exam have gone viral after a professor at the Spain's University of Málaga shared them on Twitter. "Tidying up my office, I found this university relic that we confiscated from a student a few years ago," the professor tweeted. "What an art," she added.

232.title: There's no spirit of enmity in party: Tharoor on Congress chief poll
232.article_body: Congress Presidential poll candidate Shashi Tharoor on Thursday said the party's Presidential election is about two colleagues seeing how to work to strengthen the party. "We are contesting elections, there is no spirit of enmity in our party," Tharoor added. "[Mallikarjun] Kharge sahab is my senior leader and I have worked closely with him," he stated.

233.title: Over 2,000 kg plastic seized, ₹24 lakh fine collected in 3 months: BMC
233.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has seized 2,551 kg plastic and collected ₹24.7 lakh in fines, after taking action against 494 violators in the past three months, civic officials said. "We'll suggest hotels and restaurants to use steel tiffins or another material which can be reused," officials added. If prohibited plastic is found, the BMC levies ₹5,000 as penalty.

234.title: Crypto management startup Pillow raises $18 mn in Series A round
234.article_body: Singapore-based crypto management startup Pillow has secured $18 million in Series A funding round co-led by Accel and Quona Capital, with participation from Elevation Capital and Jump Capital. The company was co-founded in 2021 by Arindam Roy, Rajath KM and Kartik Mishra. The startup earlier raised $3 million from Polygon founders, ShareChat co-founder and Dunzo CTO, among other investors.

235.title: Uddhav faction writes to EC on party symbol, alleges favouritism & foul play
235.article_body: Days after a new poll symbol and party name were cleared by the EC, Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena has written a letter to the EC, alleging "favouritism and foul play" while distributing the party symbols. The EC cleared 'mashaal' for Uddhav's faction, while Eknath Shinde's faction got 'two swords and a shield' as its party symbol.

236.title: DMK to hold protests across Tamil Nadu over 'Hindi imposition' on Oct 15
236.article_body: The DMK's youth and students wings have said they will hold protests across Tamil Nadu against the Centre's "Hindi imposition policies" on October 15. They are opposing the parliamentary panel's recommendation to make Hindi the medium of instruction in central educational institutes. "If implemented, the vast non-Hindi speaking population will be made second-class citizens," CM MK Stalin said.

237.title: AAP Gujarat chief Gopal Italia detained by Delhi Police; party workers protest
237.article_body: AAP's Gujarat chief Gopal Italia was detained by the Delhi Police from the office of National Commission for Women (NCW) on Thursday. He had been summoned by NCW chief Rekha Sharma over a video allegedly showing him using derogatory language against Prime Minister Narendra Modi. "All the AAP hooligans are outside my office creating ruckus," Sharma tweeted.

238.title: Men without self control forced women to wear Hijab: Haryana Minister
238.article_body: Talking about the ongoing hijab row in Karnataka, Haryana Health Minister Anil Vij said that men should strengthen their minds and free women from the hijab. "The men who could not control their excitement upon seeing women forced women to wear hijab," Vij said, adding that the punishment was given to women, because of which they have to cover themselves.

239.title: Samsung gets 1-year exemption from US chip curbs on China: Report
239.article_body: The United States has granted a one-year exemption to Samsung Electronics from the new rules that curbs exports of advanced chips and related equipment to China, The Wall Street Journal reported citing sources on Thursday. Following the exemption, Samsung can continue receiving chip-making equipment and other items it needs to maintain its memory-chip production in China.

240.title: Taiwanese chipmaker TSMC posts 80% rise in Q3 net profit, highest in 2 yrs
240.article_body: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company Limited (TSMC), the world's largest contract chipmaker and a major Apple supplier, posted an 80% surge in net profit at $8.81 billion for the third quarter. It's the strongest growth in two years led by sales of its advanced chips used in data centres and electric cars. TSMC's quarterly revenue rose by 36% to $20.23 billion.

241.title: Guards steal ₹83-lakh steel in Mumbai to 'teach a lesson' to employers
241.article_body: Two security guards have been booked in Mumbai for stealing 3,300 kg of steel worth ₹82.5 lakh from the company where they were posted by a security agency. Police recovered a letter which revealed that the accused conducted the theft to "teach a lesson" to their employers (agency officials), who don't pay guards for double time despite charging the company.

242.title: 2,052 encroachments cleared in Bengaluru: BBMP tells Karnataka HC
242.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has informed Karnataka High Court that 2,052 encroachments on stormwater drains (SWDs) have been removed in the city so far. A total of 504 encroachments were yet to be cleared, BBMP's report added. Earlier, the HC told BBMP to complete demolition drive on time or else it will hold back salary of its engineers.

243.title: Shraddha's 'Naagin' trilogy is very much on cards: Producer Nikhil Dwivedi
243.article_body: Amid claims that Shraddha Kapoor's 'Naagin' trilogy has been put on hold, the film's producer Nikhil Dwivedi has confirmed that it is "very much on cards". The trilogy will feature Shraddha as a shape-shifting serpent. Earlier, director Vishal Furia shared that the trilogy would present the much-loved character of Naagin in an entirely new light.

244.title: My mother, sisters never worn hijab: BJP's Poonawalla on SC's verdict
244.article_body: Reacting to the Supreme Court's split verdict in the Karnataka hijab ban case, BJP's Shehzad Poonawalla said, "My mother and sisters who studied decades ago never worn hijab...but they are practising Muslims." Further, he said, "[Congress] and PFI/CFI who used this issue to stoke...violence...were called out by Karnataka High Court [that they] must not put vote bank above women's rights."

245.title: Temba Bavuma as a captain, as a batter, is a weakness: Aakash Chopra
245.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said that South Africa captain Temba Bavuma shouldn't be in their squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup. "I'd like to apologise to him as I shouldn't be saying this to an international player...[but] Bavuma as a captain, as a batter, is a weakness," stated Aakash. Bavuma went unsold in the auction for the SA20 league.

246.title: Sona calls Farhan Akhtar 'shameless' over his silence on #MeToo accused Sajid
246.article_body: Singer Sona Mohapatra took to Twitter and criticised Farhan Akhtar over his silence towards #MeToo accused Sajid Khan's 'Bigg Boss 16' participation. "We still haven't heard from the star voice...who was also shameless enough to become UN Women India Ambassador for South Asia," she tweeted referring to Farhan. Earlier, Sona had questioned Javed Akhtar over his silence on Sajid's participation.

247.title: Expected better judgement: K'taka minister on SC's hijab case verdict
247.article_body: Commenting on the Supreme Court's split verdict in the Karnataka hijab ban case, state School Education Minister BC Nagesh said, "We had expected a better judgement as women worldwide are demanding to not wear hijab/burqa." He added that the Karnataka HC order will remain applicable in interim time. One of the SC judges said there was a "divergence in opinion".

248.title: 2 men attack transgender women in TN, chop off their hair; arrested
248.article_body: Two men were arrested on Thursday for attacking transgender women and chopping their hair off in Tamil Nadu, police said. In a video that surfaced online, one of the accused can be seen chopping off the hair of one of the transgender women and hurling abuses at them. One of the transgender women was also seen with a bruised eye.

249.title: SUV rams into tree on Eastern Express Highway in Mumbai; 2 killed, 5 injured
249.article_body: An SUV rammed into a roadside tree on the Eastern Express Highway in Mumbai's Vikhroli on Thursday, leading to the death of two people, including the car's driver. A total of five others sustained serious injuries and were shifted to a civic-run hospital, police said. The incident took place at around 12:30 am near the Kanjurmarg bus stop.

250.title: Having such a bowler gives confidence: Harmanpreet on Deepti's 3/7 vs Thailand
250.article_body: Praising all-rounder Deepti Sharma for her performance in their 74-run win against Thailand in the Women's Asia Cup T20 2022, India Women captain Harmanpreet Kaur said having a bowler like her, who's willing to bowl at any stage during the match, gives confidence to the team. Against Thailand, Deepti picked three wickets while conceding seven runs in her four overs.

251.title: Illegally stored crackers explode in Gurugram house; 6 injured
251.article_body: At least six persons of a family, including two kids, sustained severe burn injuries after illegally stored firecrackers in their house in Gurugram's Nakhrola village exploded. The explosion blew off roof and walls of house and the explosion sound was heard even by villagers a kilometre away. None of the members manufacturing firecrackers had a licence for it, police said.

252.title: 23 Russians escaping military call-up sail to S Korea, 21 denied entry
252.article_body: Twenty-three Russians onboard four yachts have sailed to South Korea since late September to avoid military call-up to fight in Ukraine, but most were denied entry, a South Korean lawmaker said. Authorities rejected entry of 21 Russians due to unclear purpose of visit and lack of documents. This comes after Russian President Vladimir Putin ordered mobilisation of 300,000 additional troops.

253.title: Kriti Sanon walks for designers Shantnu & Nikhil at Lakme Fashion Week
253.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon walked the ramp for designer duo Shantnu & Nikhil on the first day of Lakme Fashion Week. Shantnu & Nikhil's collection, titled Capella, was inspired by the Baroque era. "It's made for people who understand the importance of details, the ones who can't skip a story, and for the ones who dare to rewrite it," Shantnu said.

254.title: Wisden names India's all-time T20I XI, MS Dhoni not included
254.article_body: Ahead of T20 World Cup 2022, Wisden picked India's all-time T20I XI, with MS Dhoni not being included in the side. Wisden included Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, Suryakumar Yadav, Yuvraj Singh, Hardik Pandya, Suresh Raina, Dinesh Karthik (wicketkeeper), Ravichandran Ashwin, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Jasprit Bumrah and Ashish Nehra. Wisden stated it picked Karthik over Dhoni because of his latest comeback.

255.title: People chant 'sher aaya, sher aaya' as PM greets people in Himachal's Una, video viral
255.article_body: A video has gone viral showing people chanting 'sher aaya, sher aaya' as PM Narendra Modi greeted them in Himachal Pradesh's Una, where he flagged off India's fourth Vande Bharat train. People were also heard chanting 'Jai Shri Ram' and 'Modi Modi'. PM Modi later also addressed a gathering at the Indira Gandhi Stadium.

256.title: Frivolous and pointless: India after Pakistan's remarks on Kashmir at UNGA
256.article_body: India criticised Pakistan for raising the Kashmir issue at the UNGA debate on the Russia-Ukraine situation, calling Pakistan's remarks "frivolous and pointless". A Pakistani diplomat raised the Kashmir issue to draw parallels between the two situations. India's Permanent Representative to the UN, Ruchira Kamboj said, "Entire territory of J&K is and will always be an integral part of India."

257.title: Russia attacked Kyiv area with Iran-made kamikaze drones: Ukraine
257.article_body: Iran-made kamikaze drones hit regions around the Ukrainian capital, Kyiv, on Thursday morning, officials said. There was no immediate information on casualties, but Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's office said "critical infrastructure facilities'' in the area had been hit. In recent weeks, Ukraine has reported a series of Russian attacks in which Iran-made Shahed-136 drones were used.

258.title: HyperSocial CEO mentions firm's work culture in grandmother's death post; criticised
258.article_body: HyperSocial CEO Braden Wallake, who had gone viral for his crying selfie after layoffs at his company, announced the death of his grandmother on LinkedIn and then moved on to talk about the work culture at his firm. Criticising his post, a user wrote, "This post went from the bad news of grandma passing to promoting the company."

259.title: Kishore Kumar's work inspires me to push boundaries: Ayushmann
259.article_body: Ayushmann Khurrana said Kishore Kumar's work inspires him to "push boundaries and explore uncharted territories". He said he's been listening to the late singer's 'Aake Seedhi Lage Dil Pe Jaise' song on loop since the beginning of Dream Girl 2's shoot. "He has effortlessly rendered both male and female voices for this song," he added, calling it his "massive inspiration".

260.title: Several PCCs welcomed Kharge but not me: Tharoor
260.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor, who is running for his party's President post, said that his rival Mallikarjun Kharge was welcomed in several Pradesh Congress Committees by big leaders but the same wasn't done for him. "I visited PCCs but PCC chiefs weren't available. Not complaining, but don't you see a difference in treatment?" he said during a press conference.

261.title: Previous governments failed to understand people's needs: PM in Himachal
261.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday, while addressing a gathering in Himachal Pradesh’s Una, said his government is fulfilling people's needs which previous governments at the Centre and Himachal Pradesh failed to understand. PM Modi inaugurated India’s fourth Vande Bharat Express train from Una railway station today. "The festival of Diwali has arrived early for Una and Himachal Pradesh," he stated.

262.title: Govt approves ₹6,600 crore PM-DevINE scheme for North East region
262.article_body: Union Cabinet approved the Prime Minister's Development Initiative for North East Region (PM-DevINE) scheme for the remaining four years of the 15th Finance Commission from 2022-23 to 2025-26. The scheme will have an outlay of ₹6,600 crore. PM-DevINE is a Central Sector Scheme with 100% Central funding and will be implemented by the Ministry of Development of North Eastern Region.

263.title: Bus carrying flood affected people catches fire in Pakistan, 18 dead
263.article_body: At least 18 people, including eight children, have died after a bus carrying flood victims caught fire in Pakistan on Wednesday. The bus, which was heading from the southern port city of Karachi to Khairpur Nathan Shah, caught fire after the air conditioning unit short-circuited. Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif expressed deep grief over the loss of lives in the incident.

264.title: New India takes pride in its culture, traditions & heritage: CM Yogi
264.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Wednesday said "new India" takes pride in its culture, traditions and spiritual heritage and is strengthening national unity. "Our priests and other spiritual and great personalities have always shown us that the path to salvation lies in ‘lok kalyan’ (people’s welfare)," he added. "The new India greatly values its Vedas and Upanishads," he stated.

265.title: Maxwell key part of our team, just needs free mindset: Hazlewood
265.article_body: Talking about teammate Glenn Maxwell's form ahead of the 2022 T20 World Cup, Australia pacer Josh Hazlewood said the all-rounder is a key part of their team who adds "balance". Hazlewood added, "I think Maxwell just (needs a) free mindset and (to) play his game." Notably, Maxwell hasn't scored in double-digits in his last six T20I innings.

266.title: Amazon to launch internet satellites on ULA rocket in early 2023
266.article_body: Amazon will launch its first two prototype satellites for a planned internet-from-space constellation in early 2023. A new rocket from Boeing-Lockheed's United Launch Alliance (ULA) will be used. The prototype satellites will be part of Amazon's Kuiper network, which is a planned constellation of 3,236 low-Earth orbiting satellites that will beam broadband internet to the world's remote parts.

267.title: RBI to submit report on failure to tackle inflation since January
267.article_body: The RBI will have to submit a report to the Centre giving detailed reasons for the failure to contain prices even as inflation has been above the upper tolerance limit for nine straight months. This will be the first time since the onset of the Monetary Policy Framework in 2016 that the RBI will be asked to explain its actions.

268.title: Hyd Police shares list of roads to avoid due to heavy traffic
268.article_body: The Hyderabad Traffic Police shared list of roads to avoid due to heavy flow of traffic and peak hours. The police asked commuters to avoid roads near Taj Mahal Hotel, Apollo Hospital lane, BVB Jn, Journalist Colony and Road No 45 towards Jubilee Hills Checkpost. Traffic was hit in several areas on Wednesday night after heavy rain lashed the city.

269.title: Man gets ₹201 back from stranger he had helped last year; chat goes viral
269.article_body: A post by a LinkedIn user named Kamal Singh about receiving ₹201 from a stranger whom he had helped last year has gone viral. "On opening the chat I saw I transferred money to this guy 1.5 years back as a small help after reading his crowdfunding request on [social media]," Singh wrote along with a screenshot of their chat.

270.title: Gunshots fired at anti-hijab protestors in several Iranian cities
270.article_body:
Gunshots were fired as Iranian security forces confronted anti-hijab protestors in several cities on Wednesday. Protests are taking place in Iran over the death of 22-year-old woman Mahsa Amini. 
Amini died on September 16, days after being detained by Iran's morality police over improper hijab. Iran's Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei has accused the country's "enemies" of stoking "street riots".

271.title: Can lead to 3rd world war: Russia on admission of Ukraine to NATO
271.article_body: The admission of Ukraine to the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) can result in third world war, the deputy secretary of the Security Council of the Russian Federation, Alexander Venediktov, has said. Venediktov also repeated a Russian position that the West, by helping Ukraine, indicated that "they are a direct party to the conflict".

272.title: Need for new laws to curb superstition: CPI(M) on Kerala's human sacrifice case
272.article_body: The CPI(M) condemned the alleged human sacrifice incident reported in Kerala and said that there's need for new laws to curb such superstitious practices and urged strict implementation of the existing laws. Such an incident, which shocked human conscience, cannot be prevented by law alone but a mass public movement should emerge in society against such practices, the party added.

273.title: Auto-rickshaw driver arrested for molesting school student in Delhi
273.article_body: A 25-year-old auto-rickshaw driver was arrested from Delhi's Saket area for allegedly molesting a school student, police said. The incident took place on September 30, police added. The accused misbehaved with the girl by passing lewd and sexual comments, and also touched her inappropriately while she was on her way to meet her mother in Lajpat Nagar, police stated.

274.title: Priest stops Dalit youth from entering temple in Karnataka
274.article_body: A Dalit youth was reportedly stopped from entering the Mulkatamma temple by the priest in Karnataka's Tumakuru district. He said he went to the temple with flowers, coconut and incense sticks to pray but the priest refused to take the offerings and threw him out. The locals accused the priest of practising untouchability.

275.title: Musk sells $1 million worth of 'Burnt Hair' perfume within hours of launch
275.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk earned a million dollars within a few hours after he sold 10,000 bottles of his newly-launched 'Burnt Hair' perfume. Musk also changed his Twitter bio to 'perfume salesman' and on Thursday tweeted, "Please buy my perfume, so I can buy Twitter." The perfume is priced at $100 and being sold under The Boring Company.

276.title: 700 stubble burning incidents reported so far in 2022: Punjab minister
276.article_body: As many as 700 incidents of stubble burning have been reported in Punjab so far this year, state’s Agriculture Minister Kuldeep Singh Dhaliwal said on Wednesday. "This year 700 incidents...reported…as compared to over 2,500 incidents during the same time in previous years," Dhaliwal added. "We're constantly trying that stubble should not be burnt at least in Punjab," he stated.

277.title: Russia to use its own nuclear fuel at Zaporizhzhia plant: Rosenergoatom
277.article_body: The Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant will switch to Russian nuclear fuel after its current reserves run out, Russia's nuclear power operator Rosenergoatom reportedly said. This comes after Ukraine's nuclear energy company Energoatom accused Russia of not allowing its vehicles carrying diesel fuel to access the plant. The plant had suffered a "blackout" which increased radiation emergency risk.

278.title: 2 women jailed for husbands' murder observing Karwa Chauth fast in UP
278.article_body: About 50 women prisoners in Lucknow and 12 in Gorakhpur are observing Karwa Chauth fast after the UP government permitted them to perform all rituals associated with the festival. Among those fasting are two women prisoners accused in the murder of their husbands. Married couples who are in jail will be allowed to meet on the occasion, said an official.

279.title: I'm speechless: Tanushree on Sajid Khan's participation in 'Bigg Boss 16'
279.article_body: Actress Tanushree Dutta said she's "speechless" about filmmaker Sajid Khan's entry as a contestant in Salman Khan's show 'Bigg Boss 16'. "I am appalled too. I am speechless at the sheer irresponsibility of this action and the impact it would have on the public," she said. Several women accused Sajid Khan of sexual misconduct during the #MeToo movement in India.

280.title: Hindalco, NALCO shares rise as US mulls Russian aluminium ban
280.article_body: After aluminium prices surged nearly 7.3% on the London Metal Exchange following reports of the US considering a ban on Russian aluminium amid the Russia-Ukraine war, stock prices of Hindalco, Vedanta and NALCO rose by 1.5-3%. NALCO rose by 3.28% in opening trade on the National Stock Exchange, while Hindalco was up 3.5% and Vedanta surged by 1.2%.

281.title: Dalljiet reacts as ex-husband and BB16 participant Shalin says they are best friends
281.article_body: Actress Dalljiet Kaur has reacted after her ex-husband and Bigg Boss 16 participant Shalin Bhanot said they're best friends during an episode of the reality show. "No I'm not your best friend...Meeting once in...two months for the sake of my child does not qualify as friendship," she added. "Leave me out of your fictions and stories please," she further said.

282.title: Pic shows smoke-filled cabin of SpiceJet flight after it makes emergency landing in Hyd
282.article_body: A Twitter user shared an image of a smoke-filled cabin of a SpiceJet flight after the plane made an emergency landing at Hyderabad airport on Wednesday night due to the incident. While sharing two videos of the landing, he also said that the passengers "suffered" and had "blacked out with fear". According to officials, DGCA is probing the incident.

283.title: Google approves Donald Trump's app Truth Social for Play Store
283.article_body: Google has approved former US President Donald Trump's social media application Truth Social for distribution in the Google Play Store, a company spokesperson said. Truth Social had not been available in the Play Store due to insufficient content moderation, a Google spokesperson said in August. Donald Trump launched Truth Social after he was permanently banned from Twitter in January 2021.

284.title: Mercedes-Benz sees 28% rise in sales in India in Jan-Sept 2022
284.article_body: Mercedes-Benz India has registered 28% rise in sales, with 11,469 units sold in Jan-Sept 2022, the company said. The German carmaker sold 8,958 units in India in the same period last year. The statement added that the total order bank of Mercedes-Benz India as of September 2022 is over 7,000 units. The company sold 11,242 units in India in 2021.

285.title: Vedanta shareholders approve shifting its cash from reserves
285.article_body: The shareholders of Anil Agarwal-led Vedanta Limited on Tuesday approved Vedanta Resources' proposal to move money out of its reserves and into its balance sheet. London-based Vedanta Resources holds about 70% stake in Vedanta Limited. Vedanta said in a regulatory filing that 100% of Promoter and Promoter Group shareholders as well as public institutions voted in favour of the proposal.

286.title: Car rental startup Zoomcar may go public via SPAC deal: Report
286.article_body: Bengaluru-based car rental startup Zoomcar has reportedly reached an agreement to go public via a merger with blank-cheque firm, Innovative International Acquisition Corporation. The merger with a special purpose acquisition company (SPAC) implies a pro forma enterprise value of about $456 million for the business. Zoomcar was founded by Greg Moran and David Back in 2013.

287.title: Bengaluru likely to see rain for the rest of the week: Forecast
287.article_body: Bengaluru will see moderate to heavy rain today with thunderstorms and lightning, the Karnataka State Natural Disaster Monitoring Centre (KSNDMC) said. Meanwhile, Skymet Weather Services said that the city will likely see rainfall throughout the week. Areas within BBMP limits will have maximum and minimum temperatures around 28 and 21 degrees Celsius respectively, state's weather department said.

288.title: Assured placement with Gaming & eSports certificate program: Hero Vired
288.article_body: Hero Vired & NODWIN Gaming has launched a Certificate Program in Gaming and eSports with placement assurance. Individuals in their final year or with bachelor's degrees & experienced professionals are eligible to apply, the company said. It enables candidates to explore gaming & eSports industry with hands-on learning on various aspects like UI/UX, game mechanics, league ops, and game marketing.

289.title: Love the kind of thriller stories Sriram Raghavan tells: Katrina Kaif
289.article_body: Actress Katrina Kaif said she loves the kind of thriller stories director Sriram Raghavan tells and called him one of her favourite directors. The actress has collaborated with Raghavan for the first time for his upcoming film 'Merry Christmas', which also features Vijay Sethupathi. Talking about working with Sethupathi, Kaif said he is "a phenomenal actor".

290.title: 46-yr-old man sexually assaults 6-yr-old girl in Mumbai; arrested
290.article_body: A 46-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting a six-year-old girl in Mumbai's Kandivali West. The girl was playing near her house when the accused, a welder, reportedly took her to a deserted place and sexually assaulted her behind a tree. He also beat up the child and threatened her against telling anyone about the incident, said police.

291.title: You see that guy? I'd pick Umran in the squad all the time: Wasim Akram
291.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Wasim Akram has said he would've picked pacer Umran Malik in his squad all the time. "You see that guy? Umran...he's quick...The more he plays, the better he will become," stated Wasim. Umran has played three T20Is for India so far and has reportedly been shortlisted as one of the net bowlers for the upcoming T20 World Cup.

292.title: UN demands Russia to reverse 'illegal' annexations in Ukraine
292.article_body: The UN General Assembly has voted 143-5 to condemn Russia's "attempted illegal annexation" of four Ukrainian regions and demand its immediate reversal. Russia formally annexed Ukraine's Donetsk, Luhansk, Kherson and Zaporizhzhia regions through referendums which the West dismissed as a sham. Ukraine's UN ambassador, Sergiy Kyslytsya, called the vote at UN "amazing" and "a historic moment".

293.title: Family sacrifices 14-yr-old daughter in Gujarat for 'financial benefits'
293.article_body: A family in Gujarat's Gir Somnath district allegedly killed their 14-year-old daughter as a "sacrifice for financial benefits", police said. The girl was studying in Surat till six months ago, police added. Her parents, for unknown reasons, took her leaving certificate from the school and brought her to their native village and kept her at the farm, police added.

294.title: Matter of choice, nothing more, nothing less: Judge in K'taka hijab ban split verdict
294.article_body: The Supreme Court on Thursday delivered a split verdict in the Karnataka hijab ban case. While Justice Hemant Gupta dismissed the appeals challenging the Karnataka High Court order, Justice Sudhanshu Dhulia said, "The high court took a wrong path...It's ultimately a matter of choice, nothing more, nothing else. Uppermost in my mind was the education of the girl child."

295.title: Emily Ratajkowski says she's 'single' amid relationship rumours with Brad Pitt
295.article_body: Supermodel Emily Ratajkowski has confirmed that she is "single" amid the rumours that she was seeing Hollywood actor Brad Pitt. "I'm newly single for basically the first time in my life ever," she said in her latest interview. Emily added she is "enjoying the freedom of not being super worried" about how she is being perceived.

296.title: Peace visible on ground due to PM's special focus on Kashmir: MoS Finance
296.article_body: Minister of State (MoS) for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary on Wednesday said PM Narendra Modi’s special focus on Kashmir is bearing fruits as peace is visible on the ground. Furthermore, he said that it’s due to PM Modi’s vision that central ministers are meeting stakeholders by visiting them at their doorsteps as a part of government’s public outreach programme in J&K.

297.title: Will consult Sonia, Rahul if elected as Congress President: Kharge
297.article_body: Congress Presidential poll candidate Mallikarjun Kharge on Wednesday said that he believes in collective leadership and if elected as party’s chief, he will consult party leaders Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi on organisational matters. "Under their leadership, our party had formed government twice and framed a number of welfare schemes for the poor," Kharge added.

298.title: Liverpool's Mohamed Salah scores fastest hat-trick in Champions League history
298.article_body: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah on Wednesday scored the fastest hat-trick in the history of Champions League. The 30-year-old Egyptian came on as a substitute against Rangers in the 68th minute and netted his three goals in the 75th, 80th and 81st minutes, respectively. He set the record by scoring the hat-trick in under seven minutes.

299.title: There's a vibe of extreme nervousness at home: Shaheen on Alia's pregnancy
299.article_body: Alia Bhatt's sister Shaheen Bhatt shared that there's "a vibe of extreme nervousness and excited anticipation" at home about the actress' pregnancy. "Alia is the first among us, siblings, who will be welcoming a baby," Shaheen said, adding that the whole family is "waiting to meet the new member". Alia had announced her pregnancy in June this year.

300.title: Ukraine says it 'shot down 4 Russian helicopters' in 18 mins
300.article_body: Ukraine's Defence Ministry said that the country's forces in a span of just 18 minutes shot down four Russian helicopters "that were spoiling beautiful autumn skies in the south of Ukraine" on Wednesday. The aircraft, believed to be Soviet-era Ka-52 helicopters, were providing fire support to the ground occupation forces, Ukraine's Air Force said. Russia began invading Ukraine in February.

301.title: Wipro shares fall 6% to hit fresh 52-week low after Q2 results
301.article_body: Wipro shares fell 6% to hit a fresh 52-week low of ₹383.25 apiece on the BSE on Thursday after it reported a consolidated net profit of ₹2,659 crore for the second quarter, which was 9% less than the corresponding period last year. Its revenue from operations increased by 14.60%. Wipro gave a revenue growth guidance of 0.2-2% for October-December quarter.

302.title: IHH Healthcare starts talks with SEBI on Fortis open offer: Report
302.article_body: Malaysia's IHH Healthcare has started discussions with authorities in India, including SEBI to explore the next step for its stalled open offer for an additional 26.1% stake in Fortis Healthcare, The Economic Times cited sources as saying. The Supreme Court had in September ordered a forensic audit of the share sale of Fortis to IHH Healthcare executed in 2018.

303.title: India defeat Thailand, reach Women's Asia Cup T20 final for the 4th time in a row
303.article_body: Two-time champions India defeated first-time semi-finalists Thailand by 74 runs on Thursday to reach the Women's Asia Cup T20 final for the fourth time in a row. Batting first, India posted a total of 148/6, with opener Shafali Verma top-scoring with 42(28). India restricted Thailand to 74/9 in their 20 overs, with Deepti Sharma registering figures of 4-1-7-3.

304.title: Don't have any other babies looming, my peers told me to have 500 kids: Musk
304.article_body: On being asked if he's fathered any more children, Tesla CEO Elon Musk said, "I'm pretty sure there are no other babies looming." During an interview with The Financial Times, Musk said that some of his peers have told him to have 500 children, adding that he thinks it would be a "bit weird".

305.title: Hyderabad-bound SpiceJet flight lands safely after smoke detected in cabin
305.article_body: A Goa-Hyderabad SpiceJet flight landed safely at its destination after smoke was detected in the cabin during the descent on Wednesday. While all passengers were safely disembarked, as per airport sources, a female passenger fell ill due to the incident and is currently undergoing treatment. A total of 86 passengers were said to be on board.

306.title: Bail plea of accused in Delhi riots larger conspiracy case rejected
306.article_body: A Delhi court on Wednesday rejected the bail plea of Athar Khan, an accused in the larger conspiracy case in connection with the 2020 Delhi riots. "On the perusal of the charge-sheet and accompanying documents...allegations against the accused Athar Khan are prima facie true," the court said. Khan had purportedly told others that the time has come to "burn Delhi".

307.title: PM Modi flags off 4th Vande Bharat Express train from Himachal's Una
307.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated India's fourth Vande Bharat Express train from Himachal Pradesh's Una railway station on Thursday. The train, which will run between Una and New Delhi, accelerates to 100 km per hour in just 52 seconds. Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur, Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw and Union Minister Anurag Thakur were also present during the event.

308.title: Babar Azam must come out of average mindset, think big: Shahid Afridi
308.article_body: Former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi has criticised Babar Azam, stating that the Pakistan captain "must come out of [the] average mindset and think big". Afridi made the comment in response to Babar's remarks before Pakistan's match against Bangladesh in the ongoing tri-series in Christchurch. Babar had said he was considering giving Bangladesh a target of 160 runs.

309.title: Supreme Court delivers split verdict in Karnataka hijab ban case
309.article_body: The Supreme Court gave a split verdict in the Karnataka hijab ban case as one of the judges said there was a "divergence in opinion". While Justice Hemant Gupta dismissed the petitions challenging the Karnataka High Court order and upheld the hijab ban in educational institutions in the state, Justice Sudhanshu Dhulia said, "Wearing hijab is a matter of choice".

310.title: Cyber frauds can now be reported at all 32 police stations in Pune
310.article_body: Citizens will now be able to file cyber fraud complaints at all the 32 police stations in Pune, said Commissioner Amitabh Gupta on Wednesday. Earlier, people had to travel to the cybercrime police station at Shivajinagar headquarters for it. "We have trained the staff at all police stations about how to investigate cybercrime cases," said Police Inspector Kumar Ghadge.

311.title: Two arrested for smuggling over 30,000 packs of illegal cigarettes in GB Nagar
311.article_body: The Gautam Buddha Nagar unit of Uttar Pradesh Special Task Force arrested two people on Wednesday for smuggling over 30,000 packets of illegal cigarettes, worth ₹1.5 crore. The police arrested the suspects from the Pilkhuwa toll plaza in Hapur and recovered 21,200 packets of cigarettes from Indonesia and 9,000 packets from South Korea, along with a truck.

312.title: Kohli reacts to on-field situations, Rohit prepares in meetings: NZ's Corey
312.article_body: Talking about the captaincy approach of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, ex-NZ all-rounder Corey Anderson, who played under both the players in IPL, said, "Virat...sees things as they are and then goes by that. Rohit [is] involved in a lot of those meetings." Corey added, "I think Rohit is sort of just very proactive around how he does things."

313.title: Europe is likely entering another COVID-19 wave, warns WHO
313.article_body: The World Health Organization and European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) said there are indicators suggesting that another wave of COVID-19 infections has begun in Europe. "Although we're not where we were one year ago, it's clear that...COVID-19 pandemic is still not over," WHO Europe Director Hans Kluge and ECDC Director Andrea Ammon said in a joint statement.

314.title: Massive fire breaks out at film studio in Kolkata, 15 fire tenders deployed
314.article_body: A massive fire broke out at Eskay Movies studio in the Kudghat area in West Bengal's Kolkata on Thursday morning. With 15 fire tenders pressed into action, the fire was brought under control, fire officials said. Kolkata Police's disaster management force reached the spot where minister Aroop Biswas was also present. The fire reportedly broke out in the studio's godown.

315.title: Queen Elizabeth's life features in new comic book; pics surface
315.article_body: The life of Queen Elizabeth, Britain's longest-reigning monarch, has featured in a new comic book by TidalWave Comics. The comic book covers her public and private life, big events, family scandals, and crises. She passed away on September 8 aged 96 and was laid to rest alongside her husband Prince Philip on September 19.

316.title: Would love to make biopic on Big B, but there’s no one to play him: Balki
316.article_body: Director R Balki said he would love to make a biopic on Amitabh Bachchan but he thinks there's no one who can play him on screen. "There's not a single actor in this country who would dare to step into those shoes," he said, adding that even Abhishek wouldn't play his father on screen. "He knows it's impossible," Balki added.

317.title: Electronics dealer in Pune cheats finance firm of ₹22.74 lakh
317.article_body: An electronics and home appliance dealer in Pune allegedly cheated a finance company of ₹22.74 lakh. The accused, Pritesh Shivale, used customers' documents to avail loans from the company, according to police. When the monthly instalments were deducted from customers' accounts, they denied having purchased any home appliances. Shivale is suspected to have cheated 80 to 90 customers.

318.title: HCL disapproves dual employment, says moonlighting not a 'big issue within firm'
318.article_body: Speaking on the issue of moonlighting, HCL Technologies said that while it doesn’t approve "dual employment", it has not been a major issue within the company. HCL's Chief People Officer Ramachandran Sundararajan said, "Everybody who signs up to work for HCL…is signing up employment contract which requires exclusivity." Earlier, Wipro fired 300 employees found to be moonlighting.

319.title: Admired Emma in a way I could never explain: 'Harry Potter' star Tom Felton
319.article_body: 'Harry Potter' actor Tom Felton said he "loved and admired" his co-star Emma Watson in a way he could never explain to anybody else. "I've always had a secret love for Emma, though not perhaps in the way that people might want to hear," he said, adding there was "most definitely" a spark between the two, but at different times.

320.title: North Korea test-fires 2 cruise missiles capable of carrying nuclear weapons
320.article_body: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un oversaw the test launch of two nuclear-capable long-range strategic cruise missiles, state media reported. The two missiles flew for 10,234 seconds and "clearly hit the target 2,000 km away". The state media added that test was aimed at "enhancing the combat efficiency and might" of cruise missiles deployed "for operation of tactical nukes".

321.title: BJP only national party left, Cong reduced to brother-sister organisation: Nadda
321.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda said BJP is the only national party left in the country, while Congress has reduced to a "party of a brother and sister". "There's no other national party left. I say this with full responsibility that Congress has shrunk and it's neither a national party nor a Bharatiya party," Nadda added.

322.title: Vistadome coaches in Mumbai trains generate ₹7.32 cr revenue in 6 months
322.article_body: Around 56,895 passengers travelled in Vistadome coaches installed in several Mumbai trains in the last six months and generated ₹7.32 crore in revenue during this time. Mumbai-Madgaon Jan Shatabdi Express alone generated revenue of ₹3.35 crore with 16,078 Vistadome coach passengers. A few other trains which have Vistadome coaches are Mumbai-Pune Deccan Express, Deccan Queen and Pragati Express.

323.title: Sanju should be in scheme of things for ODIs, but not at cost of Pant: Jaffer
323.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said Sanju Samson has impressed him a lot with his recent performances and the 27-year-old should be included in the team for the ODIs. Jaffer, however, also added, "Samson should be in the scheme of things...but not at the cost of Rishabh Pant." Samson remained unbeaten in the recently-concluded South Africa ODIs.

324.title: Please buy my perfume, so I can buy Twitter, says Musk; Twitter users react
324.article_body: After offering to buy Twitter again, the world's richest person Elon Musk recently launched a new business venture, a 'Burnt Hair' perfume. On Thursday, he tweeted, "Please buy my perfume, so I can buy Twitter." Meanwhile, a Twitter user commented, "Please hire me, so that I can buy a Tesla," while another wrote, "In that case, I'm buying 10."

325.title: India reports 2,786 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 26,509
325.article_body: India reported 2,786 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 2,139 new COVID-19 cases. The active cases in India now stand at 26,509. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,28,847 following 12 casualties in the last 24 hours.

326.title: Jeev Milkha Singh gets 63 challans for Mercedes Benz car he sold in 2014 for ₹35 lakh
326.article_body: Golfer Jeev Milkha Singh has moved court in Chandigarh, seeking FIR against a car dealer and purchaser after he received court notices pertaining to 63 unpaid challans for Mercedes Benz car he sold in 2014 for ₹35 lakh. The challan violations, which have been accruing since 2015, amount to ₹83,000. He had sold the car to a Delhi-based firm director.

327.title: UP minister's nephew tries to ram his car into hotel staff for refusing to serve him food
327.article_body: An Uttar Pradesh minister's nephew was booked by the police after he allegedly tried to ram his car into a group of restaurant workers for refusing to serve him food. The hotel's owner, who claimed to be a BJP worker, said that he went to the minister’s house to complain but was asked to return as the latter was sleeping.

328.title: France accuses Russia of stoking Armenia, Azerbaijan conflict
328.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron on Wednesday accused Russia of purposefully provoking the recent clashes between Armenia and Azerbaijan. "It's an effort by Russia to destabilise. It wants to create disorder in the Caucasus to destabilise all of us," Macron said. The worst fighting between Armenia and Azerbaijan since 2020 broke out in late September, killing more than 200 people.

329.title: It's bad, this Champions League is being cruel to us: Barca manager Xavi
329.article_body: Barcelona manager Xavi Hernandez said the ongoing Champions League is being "cruel" to them after they played out a 3-3 draw against Inter Milan on Wednesday night. Barcelona, with a single win in four games so far, are facing elimination at the group stage for the second consecutive season. "What is left for us is to...focus on LaLiga," added Xavi.

330.title: Why isn’t Cong inviting Mamata, Kejriwal to join Bharat Jodo Yatra?: Sushil Modi
330.article_body: BJP leader Sushil Modi said if Congress really wants to send a message of unity, why doesn't it invite other Opposition leaders like West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal or Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao to join Bharat Jodo Yatra. His statement came after Congress' Digvijaya Singh asked RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav to join the yatra.

331.title: PepsiCo's beverage volume posts 11% growth in September quarter
331.article_body: PepsiCo's beverage unit reported a double-digit volume growth at 11% in India for the quarter ended September and mid-single-digit growth in the convenience foods unit volume. The company's net revenue from Africa, Middle East and South Asia (AMESA) division, under which India comes, surged by 3.66% to $1.72 billion. Its operating profit declined 14% amid higher commodity and operating costs.

332.title: Manoj Joshi posts video on Air India's 'worst service' after flight gets delayed by 3 hrs
332.article_body: Actor Manoj Joshi posted a video on Twitter and wrote, "Air India flight 634 was late by 3 hours and now I'm waiting for baggage to come on belt since last 40 minutes at Mumbai airport." "There's no staff here to guide or help. I have never faced such worst service till date. They spoiled my entire day," he added.

333.title: Woman killed, 5 UP policemen injured while chasing criminal in U'khand
333.article_body: A woman was shot dead in a clash between Uttar Pradesh's Moradabad Police and residents of Bharatpur village in Uttarakhand's Udham Singh Nagar district. Notably, five UP Police personnel were also injured. Moradabad Police had gone to Uttarakhand to arrest a criminal who escaped from Bharatpur and when the UP Police team reached, they were taken hostage.

334.title: Govt forms 4-member panel to probe cough syrup-related deaths in Gambia
334.article_body: The Union Health Ministry has set up a panel under Dr Y K Gupta, Vice-Chairperson of the Standing National Committee on Medicines, and three others to investigate the deaths of 66 Gambian children purportedly caused due to cough syrups manufactured by Maiden Pharmaceuticals. Earlier, Haryana stopped the cough syrups production by the company after finding violations during inspections.

335.title: Mumbai woman cheated of ₹6.40 lakh by fake 'suitor from Finland'
335.article_body: A 44-year-old Mumbai woman was allegedly cheated of ₹6.40 lakh by a man she met on a matrimonial site, who pretended to be an eye specialist from Finland. He sent her a photograph of his flight ticket to India. However, the woman received a call saying he was caught at the airport and was asked to pay for his release.

336.title: SRK, Nayanthara to shoot Jawan's last schedule in Rajasthan: Report
336.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan and Nayanthara will reportedly shoot for the last schedule of 'Jawan' in Rajasthan. As per a report, the 20-day schedule will mark the wrap of Shah Rukh and Nayanthara's shoot for the Atlee directorial. 'Jawan' marks Shah Rukh's first collaboration with Atlee and Nayanthara. The film will release in Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, Malayalam and Kannada.

337.title: Funny how I don't have news about my life: Rakul on wedding rumours
337.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh has put her wedding rumours to rest. In response to a report, which read that her brother has confirmed that marriage is on cards for Rakul and her boyfriend Jackky Bhagnani, Rakul tweeted, "It's funny how I don't have news about my life." Rakul and Jackky made their relationship official on social media platforms in 2021.

338.title: Only 27% calls to Mumbai Fire Brigade related to fire incidents
338.article_body: Of all the calls Mumbai Fire Brigade received so far this year, only 27% were related to fire incidents, as per official data. About 41% of them were rescue calls in incidents such as drowning, floods and tree collapses. Out of 6,937 emergency calls the Fire Brigade responded, 1,899 were fire incidents, while 2,833 were for rescue.

339.title: Wine shop in Hyderabad's Old City looted of cash, liquor bottles
339.article_body: A wine shop located at Chandrayangutta in Hyderabad's Old City was looted of ₹40,000 cash kept in the cash box and liquor bottles of different brands. The thieves entered the shop after making a hole in the ceiling of the shop. The police suspect that thieves scaled down into the shop using a rope and escaped through the same route.

340.title: Bhuvneshwar will probably struggle in Australia: Wasim Akram
340.article_body: Former Pakistan pacer Wasim Akram has said India pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar is likely to struggle in Australia in the upcoming T20 World Cup. "With his pace, if the ball is not swinging, Bhuvneshwar will probably struggle...he's a very good bowler no doubt...But you need pace in Australia," he explained. Wasim also termed Suryakumar Yadav as a "very dangerous" player.

341.title: Waterlogging in underpass at Bengaluru's Kadubeesanahalli due to pipeline damage
341.article_body: Bengaluru's ORR Kadubeesanahalli Underpass witnessed severe waterlogging on Thursday morning, affecting traffic movement in the area. The Mahadevapura Task Force-Mobility shared the information on its Twitter handle and said it is suspected that the outlet drain pipeline, which is 20 feet below the road level, has been damaged during the piling work by BMRCL.

342.title: 19-yr-old girl killed in leopard attack in Pune; 2nd incident in 2 months
342.article_body: A 19-year-old girl died after she was attacked by a leopard in Pune's Shirur taluka on Wednesday, officials said. The victim was in the front yard of her house when the leopard attacked her from behind and dragged her into nearby sugarcane cultivation, police said. This is the second such incident in the area over the last two months.

343.title: There is a lot to learn from India: IMF on India's social welfare programmes
343.article_body: Calling India's deployment of a direct cash transfer scheme and other similar social welfare programmes a "logistical marvel", the IMF said, "From India, there is a lot to learn." Paolo Mauro, Deputy Director of the Fiscal Affairs Department at IMF, said these programmes that seek to help people who are at low-income levels "reach literally hundreds of millions of people".

344.title: Edtech startup FrontRow fires 75% staff; 2nd round of layoffs in 5 months
344.article_body: Bengaluru-based edtech startup FrontRow has fired 75% of its workforce, around 130 employees, and is now left with a 45-member team. This is the second round of layoffs at the company in five months as it fired 30% of employees in May. The startup counts Deepika Padukone's Family Office, Lightspeed Venture Partners and Unacademy's Gaurav Munjal among its investors.

345.title: Waterlogging spots in Pune increased from 80 to 138: PMC survey
345.article_body: The number of waterlogging spots in Pune increased from 80 last year to 138 this year, showed a survey by Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC). In contrast to the past when such spots were mostly located near slums or low-lying areas, a majority of them have been identified near housing societies this time.

346.title: NGT imposes ₹900 cr fine on Delhi over unprocessed waste at 3 landfills
346.article_body: National Green Tribunal (NGT) imposed an environmental compensation amount of ₹900 crore on Delhi government over unprocessed waste at three landfills. The quantity of undisposed waste at the landfills is three crore tonnes, as per NGT's order. The deposit is to be made within one month and the deposit will be the responsibility of the Chief Secretary, NGT said.

347.title: India abstains from UN vote on Russia's illegal annexation of Ukrainian regions
