347.article_body: India abstained from voting in the UN General Assembly on a draft resolution that condemned Russia's "illegal so-called referendums" and annexation of the Donetsk, Kherson, Luhansk and Zaporizhzhia regions of Ukraine. A total of 143 members voted in favour of the resolution while five voted against it. As many as 35 members abstained from the resolution.

348.title: Video shows moment when 100-kg tyre falls off cargo plane after takeoff in Italy
348.article_body: A video has captured the moment when a 100-kg wheel fell off a Boeing 747 Dreamlifter operated by Atlas Air, right after takeoff from Taranto in Italy. A black trail of smoke could be seen coming from where the tyre snapped. The aircraft, which is mainly used for transporting Boeing 787 Dreamliner components, later landed safely in the US.

349.title: Water supply in most parts of B'luru to be disrupted on Oct 14, 15
349.article_body: Water supply in most areas of Bengaluru will be disrupted on October 14 and 15 due to maintenance work at Cauvery Water Supply Scheme Stage 1 and 2 pump houses at TK Halli, Harohalli and Tataguni. Affected areas include NTY Layout, Telecom Layout, Kasturba Nagar and Lakkasandra. Vivekananda Nagar, Chamarajpet and Kaveri Layout, among others, will also be affected.

350.title: Mumbai University students get old paper in exam due to 'technical glitch'
350.article_body: The students of various colleges associated with the University of Mumbai were offered a previous year's question paper on Wednesday, as they appeared for their second-semester exams. Mumbai University’s official spokesperson for the examination section, Vinod, claimed that it was a "technical glitch". A fresh question paper was given an hour later, the students said.

351.title: Pune college clerk cheats woman of ₹6 lakh on promise of govt job
351.article_body: Police have booked a clerk of Pune-based College of Military Engineering for allegedly cheating a woman of around ₹6 lakh on the pretext of offering her a government job in the Indian Railways in 2019. The complainant runs a canteen at INS Shivaji, where the accused was earlier posted. The complainant was shown an appointment letter while being cheated.

352.title: Gang of women thieves targeting female commuters on Delhi Metro held
352.article_body: A gang of women thieves, who used to target women commuters in the Delhi Metro, have been arrested by the Metro Police, officials said. Based on a man's complaint, police scanned CCTV footage and got clues about one of the accused. The accused confessed during questioning, following which three of her accomplices were also arrested.

353.title: 20-yr-old Mumbai boy pulls girl's dupatta with 'sexual intent'; jailed
353.article_body: A special court in Mumbai has sentenced a 20-year-old boy to three-year jail for pulling a "dupatta" (stole) of a school-going girl with "sexual intent". The victim was going to a shop when the boy pulled her dupatta and held her hand. The judge said, "[Such]...incident causes terror in...mind of people, victim and her family...and leave scar for longer time."

354.title: Delhi's landfill sites went down by 462% in just 4 months: LG office
354.article_body: Disposal of legacy waste from Delhi's landfill sites between June-September 2022 increased by 462% as compared to preceding three years, Delhi Lieutenant Governor's office said. Legacy waste at Ghazipur, Bhalswa and Okhla dropped from 229.1 lakh million tonnes (mt) in May to 203 lakh mt in September. Legacy waste at the three sites was 280 lakh mt in mid-2019.

355.title: Delhi govt increases minimum wages, new rates applicable from Oct 1
355.article_body: The Delhi government has increased the minimum wages and the new rates will be applicable from October 1, officials said on Wednesday. "Amidst the rising inflation, this is a big step taken in the interest of the labour class," said Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia, adding that Delhi has the highest minimum wages in comparison with other states.

356.title: Man hacks Mumbai Police officer's account, clears 3 passport applications
356.article_body: An unidentified person got access to the login ID and password of a Mumbai Police officer in the passport branch and cleared three applications pending verification, an official said on Wednesday. An FIR was registered against the accused for hacking into the online passport verification system managed by the Central government, he said.

357.title: 14 arrested members of PFI file plea in Delhi HC seeking compensation
357.article_body: As many as 14 arrested members of the Popular Front of India (PFI) approached the Delhi HC on Wednesday seeking their release and compensation, claiming that they were unlawfully detained. The petitioners claimed they were arrested from their homes on September 27 and weren't provided any reasons. The Centre has banned PFI and its associate outfits for five years.

358.title: India players celebrate Hardik Pandya's birthday in a small plane, Karthik shares video
358.article_body: Several Team India players including Dinesh Karthik, Rohit Sharma and Deepak Hooda celebrated all-rounder Hardik Pandya's birthday in a small plane in Australia. Sharing a video, Karthik wrote, "Celebrating birthdays on ground was too mainstream so we took it to the sky." In the video, Pandya can be seen sitting with the pilot apparently ahead of the take-off.

359.title: 5 men hack 19-year-old auto driver to death over old rivalry in Pune
359.article_body: Five men reportedly hacked a 19-year-old autorickshaw driver to death over an old rivalry in Pimpri Chinchwad on Monday evening. According to police, the deceased was driving the autorickshaw towards Rohkal when the passenger inside the auto started attacking him with a sharp weapon. Shortly, four other men in a car blocked the autorickshaw's way and attacked the driver.

360.title: Who are the top 5 batters as per latest T20I rankings?
360.article_body: New Zealand wicketkeeper-batter Devon Conway leapfrogged Australia's Aaron Finch and England's Dawid Malan to make it to fifth spot with 760 rating points in latest T20I rankings for batters. The rankings are led by Pakistan's Muhammad Rizwan (853 rating points). He's followed by India's Suryakumar Yadav (838) and Pakistan captain Babar Azam (808 points). South Africa's Aiden Markram is fourth.

361.title: Moonlighting a question of ethics, not legalities: Wipro CEO
361.article_body: On being asked whether moonlighting is legal or illegal, Wipro CEO Thierry Delaporte said, "It isn't a question of legalities, it's a question of ethics." He added, "We don't believe that it is right to have two jobs having a conflict of interest." He further said, "If other companies have no problem with that, we respect that."

362.title: India-UK FTA on 'verge of collapse' over visa comments: Report
362.article_body: After UK Home Secretary Suella Braverman questioned action over Indians overstaying their visa, the Free Trade Agreement between the two countries is on the verge of collapse, according to a UK media report. It stated that ministers of the Indian government were "shocked and dismayed" by Braverman's comments. Braverman called Indians the "largest group of people who overstay" their visas.

363.title: Ambati Rayudu, Sheldon Jackson involved in fight during match, video goes viral
363.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Baroda's Ambati Rayudu and Saurashtra's Sheldon Jackson getting involved in a fight during their Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy match. According to the on-air commentator, the fight ensued after Rayudu expressed his displeasure at Jackson taking time to get ready to face the deliveries. The umpires and players had to intervene to end their fight.

364.title: Nurse killed 5-day old baby by injecting air into his stomach, UK court told
364.article_body: A nurse allegedly killed a five-day-old baby by injecting air into his stomach through a nose tube, a UK court heard. Lucy Letby is accused of murdering seven babies and attempting to murder another ten between June 2015 and June 2016 at Countess of Chester hospital. She also allegedly sent a sympathy card to one of her victim's parents.

365.title: Passenger inserts 1066-g gold in rectum, arrested at Kochi airport
365.article_body: Air Intelligence Unit intercepted a passenger at Kerala's Kochi airport on Wednesday for allegedly trying to smuggle gold. The man had inserted four capsule-shaped packets containing 1066.75 g of gold into his rectum. He had travelled on an IndiGo flight from Doha in Qatar. This comes on the same day officials seized 3.8 kg of smuggled gold at Calicut airport.

366.title: Ayodhya verdict doesn't cover Places of Worship Act: SG tells SC
366.article_body: Solicitor General Tushar Mehta told the Supreme Court that the 2019 Ayodhya case verdict given by a five-judge Constitution bench does not deal with the validity of the Places of Worship Act, 1991. The Act protects character of religious places as it was on August 15, 1947. Petitions have been filed against the Act, calling the cut-off date "arbitrary".

367.title: Outsiders should not be allowed to cast their vote in J&K: Azad
367.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir CM Ghulam Nabi Azad on Wednesday said that outsiders should not be allowed to cast their vote in the Union Territory. "The importance of voting in Jammu and Kashmir has been that only locals vote," Azad said. His comment comes after administration's order facilitating people residing for over one year in Jammu to register as voters.

368.title: NHAI's InvIT raises funds to finance 3 additional road projects
368.article_body: National Highways Infra Trust has raised ₹1,430 crore through the placement of its units for part funding its acquisition of three additional road projects from NHAI. According to official statement, investors include Canada Pension Plan Investment Board, SBI and TATA AIG, among other investors. Units were subscribed at a premium of ₹109 over the floor price of ₹107.12.

369.title: India's national record-holding discus thrower Kamalpreet banned for 3 years for doping
369.article_body: Kamalpreet Kaur, who holds national record in women's discus throw, has been banned for three years for doping. The Athletics Integrity Unit stated that Kaur tested positive for a banned substance [stanozolol] in a test conducted on March 7 this year. Her period of ineligibility started from March 29 and all her results since March 7 stand null and void.

370.title: Ben Stokes' flying effort at boundary rope to save six goes viral
370.article_body: A video has gone viral showing England all-rounder Ben Stokes' acrobatic effort to save a shot from Australia's Mitchell Marsh from going for a six at long-off during the second T20I in Canberra. Reacting to the video, a fan tweeted, "How he did that so brilliantly!" Another fan wrote, "Unbelievable athleticism!" "His reaction time is outstanding," another tweet read.

371.title: Ola, Uber and Rapido-run autos continue services despite ban in Karnataka
371.article_body: Online booking of auto-rickshaw services continued to be available on ride-hailing platforms such as Uber, Ola and Rapido, despite Karnataka government making such services illegal from Wednesday. However, the number of auto-rickshaws using these platforms seemed to have come down as the waiting time in some places in Bengaluru went up. The move came following multiple complaints of overcharging.

372.title: Shah to inaugurate 'Gujarat Gaurav Yatra' in Ahmedabad on Thursday
372.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah will inaugurate the 'Gujarat Gaurav Yatra' in Ahmedabad on Thursday. Shah is scheduled to visit Sant Shree Savaiyanath temple to pay obeisance in Ahmedabad's Zanzarka and later visit Unai Mata Temple to offer prayers in Navsari district's Unai on Thursday. Earlier on Wednesday, BJP chief JP Nadda flagged off the yatra in Mahesana.

373.title: Thirdhand smoke can trigger skin diseases: Study
373.article_body: Thirdhand smoke, which consists of dust particles from tobacco smoke that remain on surfaces, may trigger skin diseases. According to the study, acute exposure to these particles called THS elevates levels of molecules in the body linked to diseases like contact dermatitis and psoriasis. It may also lead to other diseases, such as cancer, heart disease, and atherosclerosis, researchers said.

374.title: ₹3 cr unaccounted cash seized in Rajasthan's Sirohi, 4 arrested
374.article_body: Four persons travelling in two cars with over ₹3 crore unaccounted cash were detained in Rajasthan's Sirohi district on Wednesday, police said. The cash was recovered from the cars coming from Ahmedabad, Sirohi SP Mamta Gupta confirmed. The police found bundles of notes wrapped in paper under the seats of the two cars at Maval post, DSP Yogesh Sharma said.

375.title: 'Squid Game' actor Anupam Tripathi meets Anurag Kashyap, shares pic
375.article_body: Actor Anupam Tripathi, who played the role of Ali in the South Korean series 'Squid Game', shared a picture with filmmaker Anurag Kashyap on Instagram. "Simply an amazing moment for me. I just had a meeting with one of my favourite film directors from India," Anupam wrote along with the picture. He thanked Anurag for the "short and awesome meeting".

376.title: Swing breaks down at school in UP, 1 child dead & another injured
376.article_body: One child died and another was injured after a swing broke down at a private school in Uttar Pradesh's Bahraich. The injured student was referred to Lucknow. The family member of one of the children said, "We weren't even told what happened to [them]. We came to know that they were taken to district hospital when we came to school."

377.title: LIC sells over 2% stake in Power Grid for ₹3,079 crore in 5 months
377.article_body: Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) has sold over 2% of its holding in Power Grid Corporation over the past five months for ₹3,079.43 crore. "Corporation's shareholding in Power Grid...has diluted from 36,99,02,170 to 23,01,82,028 equity shares decreasing its shareholding from 5.303% to 3.3% of the paid-up capital of the said company," LIC said.

378.title: PVR receives shareholders approval for merger with INOX Leisure
378.article_body: Multiplex operator PVR said that it has received approval from its shareholders for the proposed merger with rivals INOX Leisure. PVR convened a meeting of its shareholders on Tuesday, following the directions of the Mumbai bench of the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT). The proposal was passed by over 99% of the number of valid votes cast.

379.title: India extends validity for sugar exports to US under quota till December 31
379.article_body: Directorate General of Foreign Trade (DGFT) said that the deadline to export raw sugar to the US under Tariff-Rate Quota (TRQ) has been extended till December 31. TRQ is the quota to export products to the US at relatively low tariffs. Total sugar exports to the US under TRQ would be around 10,475 tonnes during 2022, DGFT said in May.

380.title: Ukraine makes 'romantic' appeal to France for more weapons, shares video
380.article_body: Ukraine's Defence Ministry on Wednesday made a "romantic" appeal to France, urging the country to send more artillery to Ukraine amid Russian invasion. "Romantic gestures take many forms...But if you really want to win our hearts...nothing beats 155-mm highly mobile self-propelled artillery," the text in a video clip shared by the ministry read. France recently promised more arms to Ukraine.

381.title: Nehru delayed Kashmir's accession to India: Law Minister to Congress
381.article_body: Law Minister Kiren Rijiju on Wednesday said Jawaharlal Nehru delayed Kashmir's accession to India and the country is still paying the price for the ex-PM's follies. He was reacting to Congress' claim that Maharaja Hari Singh dithered on the question of accession. Rijiju claimed Singh had approached Nehru for accession to India in July 1947, but Nehru rejected his request.

382.title: RBI asks entities to stop taking ratings from Brickwork Ratings
382.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India has asked entities and market participants to stop taking fresh ratings and credit evaluations from Brickwork Ratings India Private Limited. On October 6, SEBI asked the credit rating agency to wind down operations and cancelled its Certificate of Registration (CoR). The instructions regarding existing ratings issued by Brickwork shall be advised separately, RBI said.

383.title: India's projected debt ratio to be 84% of GDP: IMF
383.article_body: Paolo Mauro, Deputy Director, Fiscal Affairs Department, International Monetary Fund, said India's debt ratio is projected to be 84% of its GDP by the end of 2022. Mauro stressed that it is important for India to have a very clear medium-term objective on the fiscal. "It would be very important to give reassurance that things are under control," he added.

384.title: Punjab govt allows green crackers from 8 pm to 10 pm on Diwali
384.article_body: Punjab Minister Gurmeet Singh Meet Hayer on Wednesday said only green crackers will be allowed for two hours from 8 pm on Diwali. He added crackers will be permitted from 4 am to 5 am and from 9 pm to 10 pm on 'Gurpurab'. They will be allowed from 11.55 pm to 12.30 am on Christmas and New Year.

385.title: Pak PM Shehbaz Sharif, son acquitted in PKR 16-billion money laundering case
385.article_body: Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif and his son Hamza were acquitted by a special court of the Federal Investigation Agency (FIA) in a money laundering case on Wednesday. The FIA had booked Sharif and his sons for allegedly committing over PKR 16 billion in money laundering in 2020. "Another fabricated case created for political victimisation comes to its...end," the PML-N tweeted.

386.title: Govt scraps privatisation of Bhadravati steel plant on low bidder interest
386.article_body: The Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM) said the privatisation of SAIL’s Bhadravati steel plant has been scrapped due to low bidder interest. The transaction was annulled with the approval of Alternative Mechanism (Empowered Group of Ministers). DIPAM said multiple Expressions of Interest (EoIs) had been received and qualified bidders had conducted due diligence.

387.title: Salman Khan whitewashing his toxic masculinity: Sona on #MeToo accused Sajid
387.article_body: Speaking about Sajid Khan's participation in 'Bigg Boss 16', singer Sona Mohapatra tweeted that the show's host and actor Salman Khan is whitewashing his own toxic masculinity. "Continues the whitewashing in the BRO-HOOD...(Btw his gifting watches/food truck/surgeries is only more virtue signalling)," she added. Several women accused Sajid of sexual misconduct during the #MeToo movement in 2018.

388.title: Secret ballot for Cong Prez polls to ensure level playing field: CEA Mistry
388.article_body: The Presidential polls for the Congress party will have a secret ballot to ensure a level playing field for both Mallikarjun Kharge and Shashi Tharoor, the party's Central Election Authority Chairman Madhusudan Mistry said. Mistry further added that the polling authority cannot stop any individual from campaigning. The ballot papers will be mixed before counting starts, Mistry added.

389.title: India's factory output in August contracts for the first time in 18 months
389.article_body: India's Index of Industrial Production contracted 0.8% year-on-year in August for the first time in 18 months, according to government data released on Wednesday. Month-on-month, the index declined 2.3% compared with a decline of 2.9% in July. Mining output fell 3.9%, while manufacturing activity fell by 0.7%, indicating a broader slowdown in the country.

390.title: Mohammad Shami confirms he is going to Australia ahead of T20 WC, shares pics from flight
390.article_body: Pacer Mohammad Shami on Wednesday confirmed that he is going to Australia ahead of the T20 World Cup 2022. Sharing pictures from a flight on Instagram, the 32-year-old pacer wrote, "Time to fly now for T20 World Cup." Shami is reportedly in contention to replace the vacant spot left by injured Jasprit Bumrah in India's T20 World Cup 2022 squad.

391.title: Adda247 raises $35 million led by WestBridge Capital, Google and Info Edge
391.article_body: Ed-tech platform ﻿Adda247 announced raising $35 million in a round led by WestBridge Capital. The round also saw participation from Google as a new investor and existing investors, Info Edge and Asha Impact. The company said the funds will be used to enhance its tech and product profile, expand its student counselling team, and hiring for some key leadership roles.

392.title: HCL Tech net profit increases 7% to ₹3,489 crore in Q2
392.article_body: IT major HCL Technologies announced that its consolidated net profit saw a 7.05% year-on-year growth, taking it to ₹3,489 crore in the quarter ended September 2022. The company registered a revenue of ₹24,686 crore, clocking a 19.5% growth over ₹20,655 crore last year. Sequentially, revenue rose 5.2% from ₹23,464 crore in quarter ended June 2022.

393.title: Wipro registers ₹2,659 crore net profit in Q2 FY23; sees Y-o-Y decline of 9%
393.article_body: IT services firm Wipro released its Q2 results, reporting consolidated net profit of ₹2,659 crore, which was 9% less than ₹2,930 crore in the same period last year. The company's revenue from operations stood at ₹22,539.7 crore, a 14.60% increase over ₹19,667.4 crore in the previous year. Sequentially, profit rose 3.71% from ₹2563.6 crore in the previous quarter.

394.title: Got nose job to look prettier, it's my face, why wouldn't I: Shruti
394.article_body: Actress Shruti Haasan said it is very obvious that she got her nose fixed as she did her first film with her "old nose". "My nose was broken...And people are like she's just using the deviated septum excuse," she said. "I did have a deviated septum...But if I could make it prettier, it's my face, why wouldn't I?" Shruti added.

395.title: Fireside Ventures raises $225 million for third fund
395.article_body: Fireside Ventures﻿ announced that it has raised third fund at $225 million (₹1,830 crore), which is the largest capital raised yet by the five-year-old firm. The early-stage investor said the new fund would invest in about 25-30 Indian startups focusing on the health and wellness, lifestyle and consumer goods categories. Investors include SBI, ITC and Premji Invest, among other firms.

396.title: ICC names 5 changes to playing conditions to keep an eye on during T20 World Cup
396.article_body: ICC named five changes to playing conditions to keep an eye on during T20 World Cup 2022. They include five-run penalty for unfair movement by fielding side, new batter to take strike after caught dismissals, in-match over penalty for slow over-rate, batters requiring to have some part of their bat/body within pitch and 'mankading', which is no longer 'unfair play'.

397.title: American Idol fame Willie shared video of him singing in car on Insta hours before death
397.article_body: Singer Willie Spence, who passed away in a car accident aged 23, had shared a video of himself singing inside a car hours before his accident. "Lord you are my hiding place," he had captioned the video. Reacting to his post, singer Katharine McPhee Foster wrote, "You're with Jesus now. God bless you. Thankful for the time we had."

398.title: Shouldn't boycott film when govt is doing best to better economy: Rakul
398.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh said the film industry suffers when a film gets boycotted. She added there's a chain reaction that follows after a film gets boycotted. "Employment goes down. At a time when the government is doing its best to better the economy, we shouldn't advocate these things," she added. Recently, several films faced 'boycott' calls on social media.

399.title: 25 lakh people affected due to floods after incessant rains in UP
399.article_body: Around 25 lakh people from 2,000 villages in Uttar Pradesh's 15 districts are affected due to floods after incessant rainfall in the state. The discharge from Nepal dams has resulted in the swelling of the Ramganga river in the Bareilly district. CM Yogi Adityanath made an aerial survey of flood-affected areas in the Balrampur, Shravasti and Gonda districts.

400.title: Mercedes-Benz, Microsoft collaborate to improve auto production
400.article_body: Mercedes-Benz and Microsoft have collaborated to use Microsoft Cloud for a data platform to improve production efficiency at auto plants around the world. According to a statement, the data platform is called MO360, and is presently available in Europe, the Middle East and Africa. The collaboration is aiming for a 20% increase in vehicle production efficiency by 2025.

401.title: Broccoli gas can help in finding life on other planets: Scientists
401.article_body: Scientists believe broccoli gas could help provide compelling evidence of life on other planets. In order to expel toxins, broccoli, like other organisms, adds one carbon and three hydrogen atoms to an unwanted chemical and turns the potential toxin into a gas that floats away into atmosphere safely. Detection of such gases on other planets may hint at alien life.
